data.name: ActivateMobilePhoneEmptyCode
data.value: Validation code field cannot be empty

data.name: ActivateTfaAppEmptyCode
data.value: Validation code field cannot be empty

data.name: AdminMessageSent
data.value: Your message was successfully sent. You will be contacted by the portal administrator.

data.name: ChangePortalOwnerMsg
data.value: A link to confirm the operation has been sent to :email (the email address of the portal owner).

data.name: ConsumersBitlyDescription
data.value: Enable this application to shorten portal invitation links and shared links in the Documents module with the Bitly service.

data.name: ConsumersBitlyInstruction
data.value: If you add the Bitly service you will get shortened links to invite new users to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal and shortened links to documents in the Documents module that have been shared with external users.

data.name: ConsumersBitlyInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to shorten the invitation and document links. {0}Insert your Bitly login and API key below:

data.name: ConsumersBoxDescription
data.value: Enable the application to manage Box files and folders.

data.name: ConsumersBoxInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the Box service you will be able to connect your Box account in the Documents module. This will allow to upload and create new files in Box, edit existing ones, copy and delete them, share files and folders with ONLYOFFICE™ portal users.

data.name: ConsumersBoxInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to connect your Box account to the Documents module. You’ll be able to manage, edit, and share files from Box with ONLYOFFICE users. {0}Sign in to your account on the Box developers page and create a new app for ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersClickatellDescription
data.value: Enable the application for the two-factor authentication via Clickatell.

data.name: ConsumersClickatellInstruction
data.value: Adding the Clickatell service application you will be able to enable the two-factor authentication and receive an SMS with a code allowing the user to enter ONLYOFFICE portal.

data.name: ConsumersClickatellInstructionV11
data.value: Use this app to enable two-factor authentication with Clickatell service. {0}Sign in to your SMS Platform account and create a new integration for ONLYOFFICE. Copy an apiKey and insert it below:

data.name: ConsumersDocuSignDescription
data.value: Enable the application to digitally sign your documents with DocuSign.

data.name: ConsumersDocuSignInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the DocuSign service you will be able to sign files from the Documents module. This will allow to send a file for electronic signature to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal employees via the DocuSugn service. The signed file will be saved in the ONLYOFFICE™ Documents module.

data.name: ConsumersDocuSignInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to digitally sign documents using DocuSign. {0}Go to your DocuSign Admin Console and add ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersDropBoxDescription
data.value: Enable the application to manage Dropbox files and folders.

data.name: ConsumersDropBoxInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the Dropbox service you will be able to connect your Dropbox account in the Documents module. This will allow to upload and create new files in Dropbox, edit existing ones, copy and delete them, share files and folders with ONLYOFFICE™ portal users.

data.name: ConsumersDropBoxInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to connect your Dropbox account to the Documents module. You’ll be able to manage, edit, and share files from Dropbox with ONLYOFFICE users. {0}Sign in to your account on the Dropbox Developers website and create a new app for ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersEasyBibDescription
data.value: Enable this application to create bibliographic lists in documents with EasyBib.

data.name: ConsumersEasyBibInstruction
data.value: When you add the EasyBib application, you can easily create bibliographic lists in your documents.

data.name: ConsumersFacebookDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a Facebook account.

data.name: ConsumersFacebookInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the Facebook service you will be able to connect your Facebook account on your profile page so that you can sign in to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal using it. You will also be able to find a Facebook account of a contact in the CRM module and link it on the 'Edit person/company' page.

data.name: ConsumersFacebookInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to allow your users to sign in to ONLYOFFICE using Facebook and link their customers’ Facebook accounts to the CRM module. {0}Go to Facebook Developers Portal and create a new app ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersFirebaseDescription
data.value: Enable this application to receive notifications about the messages sent to you with Firebase Cloud Messaging.

data.name: ConsumersFirebaseInstruction
data.value: If you connect Firebase Cloud Messaging you will be able to receive notifications about the messages sent to you even when you are offline.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleCloudbucketDescription
data.value: Enter the name of the Google Cloud bucket for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleCloudDescription
data.value: Connect Google Cloud Storage service to backup and store data from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleCloudInstruction
data.value: When you add Google Cloud Storage service to your portal, you can use it to create backups of your portal making sure no data will be ever lost. Use it also to store data and static content from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleDescription
data.value: Connect the project to sign in to the portal using a Google account and manage Google Drive files and folders.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleInstruction
data.value: If you add a project of the Google service you will be able to connect your Google account on your profile page so that you can sign in to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal using it as well as connect your Google Drive account in the Documents module. This will allow to upload and create new files in Google Drive, edit existing ones, copy and delete them, share files and folders with ONLYOFFICE™ portal users.

data.name: ConsumersGoogleInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to connect your Google Drive account to the Documents module. You’ll be able to manage, edit, and share files from Google Drive with ONLYOFFICE users. {0}Go to Google APIs console and create a new project for ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersLinkedInDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a LinkedIn account.

data.name: ConsumersLinkedInInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the LinkedIn service you will be able to connect your LinkedIn account on your profile page so that you can sign in to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal using it.

data.name: ConsumersLinkedInInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to allow your users to sign in to ONLYOFFICE using their LinkedIn accounts. {0}Go to the LinkedIn Developers website and create a new app ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersMailruDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a Mail.ru account.

data.name: ConsumersMailruInstruction
data.value: When you add the Mail.ru application you can enable signing in to the portal using the Mail.ru account on your profile page.

data.name: ConsumersRackspaceDescription
data.value: Connect Rackspace Cloud Storage service to backup and store data from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersRackspaceInstruction
data.value: When you add Rackspace Cloud Storage service to your portal, you can use it to create backups of your portal making sure no data will be ever lost. Use it also to store data and static content from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersRackspaceprivate_containerDescription
data.value: Enter the URL address of the Rackspace private container for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersRackspacepublic_containerDescription
data.value: Enter the URL address of the Rackspace public container for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersRackspaceregionDescription
data.value: Enter the region where your Rackspace containers are located.

data.name: ConsumersS3bucketDescription
data.value: Enter the unique name of the Amazon bucket for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersS3Description
data.value: Connect Amazon AWS S3 to backup and store data from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersS3Instruction
data.value: When you add Amazon AWS S3 to your portal, you can use it to create backups of your portal making sure no data will be ever lost. Use it also to store data and static content from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersS3regionDescription
data.value: Enter the AWS region where your Amazon bucket resides.

data.name: ConsumersSelectelDescription
data.value: Connect Selectel Cloud Storage service to backup and store data from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersSelectelInstruction
data.value: When you add Selectel Cloud Storage service to your portal, you can use it to create backups of your portal making sure no data will be ever lost. Use it also to store data and static content from your portal.

data.name: ConsumersSelectelprivate_containerDescription
data.value: Enter the name of the Selectel private container for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersSelectelpublic_containerDescription
data.value: Enter the name of the Selectel public container for storing backups.

data.name: ConsumersSkyDriveDescription
data.value: Enable the application to manage OneDrive files and folders.

data.name: ConsumersSkyDriveInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the OneDrive service you will be able to connect your OneDrive account in the Documents module. This will allow to upload and create new files in OneDrive, edit existing ones, copy and delete them, share files and folders with ONLYOFFICE™ portal users.

data.name: ConsumersSkyDriveInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to connect your OneDrive account to the Documents module. You’ll be able to manage, edit, and share files from OneDrive with ONLYOFFICE users. {0}Sign in to your Microsoft Azure account and create a new app for ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersSmscDescription
data.value: Enable the application for the two-factor authentication via SMS Center.

data.name: ConsumersSmscInstruction
data.value: Adding the SMS Center service application you will be able to enable the two-factor authentication and receive an SMS with a code allowing the user to enter ONLYOFFICE portal. SMS Center application is useful as a provider for CIS countries.

data.name: ConsumersSmscInstructionV11
data.value: Use this app to enable two-factor authentication with SMS Center service. {0}Insert your smsc account login and your password (or password MD5 hash) in lower case:

data.name: Consumerssmscpsw
data.value: Password or password MD5 hash in lowercase

data.name: ConsumersTwilioDescription
data.value: Enable this application to call CRM contacts with Twilio.

data.name: ConsumersTwilioInstruction
data.value: After you add Twilio, you will be able to call any CRM contact right from the browser.

data.name: ConsumersTwilioInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to allow your users to call their contacts from the CRM module using Twilio. {0}Go to Twilio Console and paste the following data below:

data.name: Consumerstwiliosender
data.value: Phone number from Twilio (required for SMS authorization)

data.name: ConsumersTwitterDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a Twitter account and search for contacts.

data.name: ConsumersTwitterInstruction
data.value: If you add an application of the Twitter service you will be able to connect your Twitter account on your profile page so that you can sign in to the ONLYOFFICE™ portal using it. You will also be able to find a Twitter account of a person in the CRM module and link it on the 'Edit person/company' page and then view Twitter news feed.

data.name: ConsumersTwitterInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to allow your users to sign in to ONLYOFFICE using their Twitter and link their customers’ Twitter accounts to the CRM module. {0}Go to Twitter Developers Portal and create a new app ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersVkDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a VK account.

data.name: ConsumersVkInstruction
data.value: When you add the VK application you can enable signing in to the portal using the VK account on your profile page.

data.name: ConsumersWordpressDescription
data.value: Enable the application to publish documents directly in WordPress.

data.name: ConsumersWordpressInstruction
data.value: Adding the WordPress application you can easily publish the documents on your WordPress website, saving their formatting.

data.name: ConsumersYahooDescription
data.value: Enable the application to import users from the Yahoo service.

data.name: ConsumersYahooInstruction
data.value: Adding the Yahoo service application you will be able to add ONLYOFFICE portal new users from the contact list.

data.name: ConsumersYahooInstructionV11
data.value: Enable this app to add new portal users from your Yahoo contact list. {0}Go to the Create Application page in the Yahoo Developer Network and create a new app for ONLYOFFICE integration. Insert the data you received below:

data.name: ConsumersYandexDescription
data.value: Enable the application to sign in to the portal using a Yandex account.

data.name: ConsumersYandexInstruction
data.value: When you add the Yandex application you can enable signing in to the portal using the Yandex account on your profile page.
